abstract.p: Police arrest Joel Lafayette, gypsy-cab driver accused of raping two women in separate incidents in Brooklyn (S)

block.p: A gypsy-cab driver accused of raping two women in separate incidents in Brooklyn last week was arrested last night, police said.

The authorities identified the driver as Joel Lafayette, 24. They said that he picked up a 21-year-old female passenger early yesterday at the intersection of Nostrand and Church Avenues in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn and stopped at Avenue J and Troy Avenue, where he raped her at knifepoint.

On Wednesday, the police said, Mr. Lafayette picked up an 18-year-old woman at Flatbush and Church Avenues and drove a short distance before he pulled his vehicle over and raped her.
The police said that Mr. Lafayette was operating a van without a license from the city's Taxi and Limousine Commission.
So-called gypsy cabs are popular in the city because they often run along the same routes as city buses and typically charge a $1 fare.
